biography_text: LIPINSKI, Daniel,  (son of William Oliver Lipinski), a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., July 15, 1966; B.S., Northwestern University, Evanston, Ill., 1988; M.S., Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1989; Ph.D., Duke University, Durham, N.C., 1998; professor, James Madison University Washington Program, Washington, D.C., 2000; professor, University of Notre Dame, South Bend, Ind., 2000-2001; professor, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 2001-2004; staff, United States Representative George Edward Sangmeister of Illinois, 1993-1994; staff, United States Representative Jerry Francis Costello of Illinois, 1995-1996; staff, United States Representative Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois, 1999-2000; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Ninth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-present).
